text:
Idk why they get such a high rated for such a dishes. maybe they never had real Japanese Italian. They smells very bad and most of dishes too salty. They might trying to sell drink thats why it was so salty....  some seafood also smelled and they are trying to kill refrigerator smell tp use extra garlic and pepper, but still smelled. 

We had family came from Cali and we checke yelp that they wanted to try such a high rated Italian dishes. But it was just such a disappointment.

food ordered: miso pasta

food: this is like a japanese/italian fusion restaurant.  waitress said that the japanese influence gives the pastas a broth-ier base. flavor of the pasta was ok... more of a creamy miso.  unfortunately my food came out a bit on the warm to cool side, the rest of the food orders came out looking like they were pipping hot. 

service: waitress was sweet and informative, gave us plenty of time to decide what we wanted.

Growing up in an asian family, mum is always making pasta with soy sauce or something asian. 

This place gives that a whole new meaning, using uniquely japanese ingredients with italian. 

We ordered the uni(urchin) tomato pasta and the squid ink pasta. Both were nothing less than amazing! 

Often, pasta can get a little sickening and oily, but not the ones from here. 
The urchin was creamy and fresh and works ridiculously well with a tomato based spaghetti. 
The squid ink was strong and flavoursome with fresh seafood, loved it!

Maybe I'm biased because I'm asian, but this place is like every asian mums pasta on steroids. Gonna have to up your game mum...

A friend recommended this restaurant and we weren't quite sure about it at first because there was no one in the restaurant when we got there at 6:30 PM.  We decided to Yelp it and saw that it had great reviews so we decided to stay. We're so glad we did. EVERYTHING was delicious! From the bread to the salad, entrees and desserts, everything was spectacular. We had squid ink pasta, Kobe style skirt steak, and the linguini and clams pasta. We finished off with the dessert trio. Yummy!!! 

We will definitely come here again and again! We think the restaurant is not in a prime location to get the business it deserves! We came in on a slow night for them and we hope that it was just an off night with patrons for them.  We HIGHLY recommend this restaurant!! :-)

The restaurant was nice.  Friendly group of people.  Had the beef carpaccio, I've definitely had better, the slices were  thick, but not high grade kobe beef that melts in your mouth type of kobe.  The fetti was good but matched with a basil leaf, poorly done, since the basil leaf didn't match with the sauce or the fish eggs that well.  Overall, decent, but with competitors like Raku and Monta and Big Wong in the same plaza, its hard for this restaurant to shine.

We originally planned on eating at Roku but they were booked solid so a quick read of Yelp reviews made our decision about Trattoria Nakamura-Ya, and we're glad we did. The food was AMAZING. We even ordered a squid ink spaghetti for the table just so we could say we tried it, and it was delicious. I would certainly come back again and recommend this Italian Japanese fusion to anyone.

My favorite restaurant in Vegas so far, don't miss it! Always liked Japanese-Italian (a combination of two great cuisines), and this place was particularly good. We had 
the snow crab salad - a lot of real crab meat, 
the Linguini "Uni" Tomato Cream - so flavorful, even though sea urchin is heavy but the tomato cream balanced it out and made it amazing, 
"Kinoko" Creamy Meat Sauce ~Your choice of pasta - refreshing but with great balance of beef and tomato, 
Soymilk Panna Cotta w / Okinawan Black Sugar - the black sugar tasted AMAZING.
Stopped by for a quick lunch. Happy hour at 2pm every day!  Had the fried oysters. Delicious. Soft shell crab appetizer. Delicious. Uni tomato cream linguini. Delicious. Will definitely come back!

My husband and I tried Trattoria today based on yelp reviews. Honestly, Trattoria Nakamura-Ya deserves the 4.5 stars Yelp indicates. We had the Pasta A meal option that came with an appetizer, a pasta and a drink for one flat rate. The garlic and almond sauce for the calamari as as an appetizer is to die for! We tried the Spaghetti with mushrooms, onions and sausage entree. It was delicious! 

Next time we're in town, we're definitely are coming back AND I would recommend them to anyone who loves Italian or Japanese. The fusion is a brilliant idea! 

Jenna and Rachael were also attentive and positive! Thanks all!

Fantastic! Being Japanese myself, I'm very familiar with the flavors of Italian-Japanese cuisine. I find that it's more calorie friendly than traditional Italian food and requires higher quality ingredients. This place was spot on. Ordered a few dishes and loved all of them. Great staff, very attentive and sweet. I'll be back soon.
This is a great spot!  The staff is friendly and efficient.  The food is great!  I highly recommend this restaurant.
The prix fix is good deal app entr√©e and glass of wine or other non alcoholic drink. Very clean place, good service.

This is one of the coolest places in Vegas. What a great combination of food?! The portions maybe little, but the food is packed with so much flavor.  Very interesting combination of flavors. The staff was great as well. Definitely one of my favorite places.

Even though most people would find Japanese-inspired Italian food to be a weird combo, it was most definitely not, and this place does a pretty good job at fusing them together

I ordered the Kinoko Creamy Meat Sauce, which had this perfectly rich and creamy sauce that I could not get enough of. My mom got the Spaghetti  and Jidori chicken, which had an excellent broth and perfect noodles, but the chicken wasn't as amazing in comparison to the two. My sisters ordered the Fettuccine broccoli and kurobuto sausage, one with the tomato cream sauce it comes with and one with alfredo, the basic cream sauce. They both thought the food was tasty, but wished it had more broccoli, and my one sister did not like the tomato cream sauce as much, saying it was a little runny. My aunt got their vegetarian pasta dish, and loved the sauce. 

Overall, this was a pretty great find and so delicious!

first expereince here and have heard nothing but good things and was excited to try out the food uni spaghetti was delicious...bruschetta was perfectly toasted and had a lot of great flavors. the mussels (escargot) style wast outstanding. it comes with 3 differnent types and 2 of them were outstanding and 1 was decent. service was quite friendly and attentive. chefs were very friendly and said hello and see you later at the end of the meal. nice btg list and beer list. tv inside on espn always makes it better.

Excellent. I got the baked tomato gratin and the calamari in a garlic lime sauce.  The waitress was friendly and love the Italian-Mexican theme. The food took a little longer than expected, but the food was well prepared. Nice quiet place. I would definetely go back.

Interesting idea but everything is way too salty . The most famous tomato cream uni pasta is actually a big disappointment to me. The tomato cream completely cover the uni taste and the uni was in such a small pieces that you can't even feel the creamy texture of uni. The service is good though.
It's pricy but worth it. We went to nakamura ya while vacationing in Vegas and we were pleased with the food and the service. We went twice while there. We'll come back again!

Rating is more like 3 1/2 stars:

A very intriguing concept considering Italian and Japanese are such a contrast from each other. However, I enjoyed their dishes and how they incorporated traditional pastas with Asian flair. A friend and I went in on a Thursday around 3pm for happy hour and it was completely empty besides one other patron. The hostess was quite friendly and the kitchen was open where you can see a chef prepping. The spacing is quite tight, so I was thankful that we had the restaurant to ourselves. 

I started off with a glass of their sauvignon blanc, I was disappointed in the serving glass. It was served in a small, hard plastic champagne glass instead of an actual wine glass.  But, being the passive person that I am (not every time, though), I let the matter drop and didn't complain. For the appetizers, I ordered the fried oysters and the spaghetti with asparagus, tomato, clams, and white sauce for my main. I actually enjoyed my dishes and whatever bread they served was super good! The best part was that I was full at the end of our meal. There wasn't anything spectacular about our experience (it's been a couple weeks since dining here so I've forgotten most of my experience), but the food was good. 

I'm not sure if I'll go out of my way to visit again, because I tend to avoid eating in China town. Not to sound offensive, but you just hear one too many "instances" regarding health and sanitation to the point that it becomes a disgusting pattern. But if, for whatever reason, I find myself in China town again, then I will most likely stop here for a quick bite.  I just love the Italian twist.

I love fine dining restaurants.  Like Costa di Mare at the WYNN and Prime at Bellagio and N9NE at Palms.  I went here, and I love WINE.  They served the WINE in the SMALLEST wine glases I have EVER SEEN....and I moved to Vegas in 1956.  Literally a few sips and that is IT. I enjoy Cabernet Sauvignon.  They CHARGED US $15 per glass which I felt was totally OUTRAGEOUS.  The tiniest wine glass I have ever seen.  Intolearable.  My office is 4 minutes away.  So they lost a great ongoing customer. So I spent $60 for our wine.....and the amount was so small.

So, i visited this restaurant at jan 08, 2012. I am a chinese, so u will see some chinese point of view of this restaurant. My girlfriend and I went there to try. It is a small restaurant but the size is doesnt matter. The waitress greeted us right away when my right foot steped into the door. It was clean and we picked our own table because there not much people. We ordered FRIED CHICKEN and KOBE BEEF CARPACCIO. 

The taste of the chicken was quite special. It wasnt very special but smell good. 
The kobe beef can be thinner but it taste good also.
Then we ordered two pasta. UNI AND TOMATO SAUCE PASTA and MISO CARBONARA.

The uni one tasted like uni but not fishy. They gave us two little bottle of red pepper and chees to add on, just like the things that you put on your pizza or not. I put both on the pasta, it surprisingly tasted great. It added more layer on the flavor to play with your taste bugs. 
The miso carbonara tasted like regular carbonara but with miso flavor. i also added cheese and pepper on it. It didnt surprise me this time coz i had been surprised on the first time. It tasted good also. 

The service was great. Our waitress keep wiping our table and refilling my water. She was great. I didnt ask for her name becoz it considers as a "flirting act" in front of my gf. 

This is the first time i feel good when i tipped the waitress. Normally, i didnt feel good when doing the tipping section. 
I would recommand to other people u like to go there .

They are known as a Italian/Japanese fusion restaurant, which makes them very unique. I've come here a couple of times and I haven't been disappointed. 
Although, it is a bit overpriced. I would suggest going during their happy hour which is from 2pm-5pm every day. 
I would recommend the spaghetti chicken pasta ($7.99) and for an appetizer the fried chicken ($3-4)  is really good.  So if you wanna try something new I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

I've come here a few times whenever I'm craving their Uni Tomato Cream Pasta, which is like the best pasta dish ever lol. My only complaint here is that some of their other dishes are mediocre. I've tried the Squid ink pasta, Fettuccine Parma Prosciutto Carbonara, Pan Fried Calamari, and Salmon & Ikura fettuccine. The Squid Ink and the Prosciutto Carbonara were decent, but not up to par with the Uni Pasta. The Calamari and the Salmon Fettuccine were just mediocre, and the Salmon fettuccine tasted especially fishy to me. I'll only be ordering their Uni pasta from now on which is a solid 5/5. I'll be back to satisfy my Uni pasta cravings!

I am subtracting one star because it was entirely too hot inside of this restaurant. If I'm out and about on a hot Vegas day, I am surely trying to escape to a place that will make me feel as comfortable as I feel in my home (temperature-wise) 

Besides my personal discomfort, the food here is amazing and the service is equally satisfying. They have amazing fusion options, but I opted for the squid ink pasta. This is a blessing to Las Vegas. I was extremely excited about this because when I visited Sicily I was looking for this dish and could not find it. Well worth the wait.

We went in with high expectations due to the raving reviews on yelp. 

We ordered the beef carpaccio, fried chicken , and fried sea bass. 

The beef carpaccio was ok but small portion for the $13 for the large. The sea bass was bland. The saving grace was their karrage . It was extremely juicy especially with the salad on top. 

For the entree, I ordered the uni tomato pasta. It was good but not fantastic. Definitely not the $27 menu price.  

Finally, we ordered the soy milk panacotta. It was ok. 

Everything here was ok. The service was just that, ok.

It feels like raku pricing for Italian food
Delicious food. Great lunch specials. Very authentic Japanese/Italian. pasta was perfectly cooked.
Tomato cream uni pasta!!!  So good!  But the flavors of the tomato cream is very "the Japanese" version of pasta sauce.  You either love it or hate it.  Growing up with it I love it!

I came here the other night for their anniversary special. 50% off their squid ink pasta and 50% off their Uni Tomato Cream Pasta. My friend and I ordered one of each plus their their shabu shabu salad. Once we ordered, the food came out really quickly or my friend and I were enjoying each other's company. The salad was pretty big for 2 people to share. It had leafy lettuce pieces along with thinly sliced shabu shabu meat. It was pretty good except for the abundant amount of onions. The squid ink pasta was just okay. It made my mouth really black, and I didn't like that I had to keep wiping my mouth off. There wasn't much taste to it. I did really enjoy the uni cream pasta. I normally don't like uni, but you can't taste it. It was very creamy and very delicious. The servers are very fast at working, clearing my plate, refilling water. 

Too bad the uni pasta is normally $26. Otherwise, I'd totally get it more often!

Came here before heading into the strip. It was delicious. Japanese Italian fusion. Everything was so light and tasty. We did the prix fixe menu which came with an appetizer, pasta entree and a drink. I got a beer! I didn't regret it. The price was amazing as well. Spent less than 20 per person. I feel like this is food I would eat in Japan. My wife who is Japanese thought the hamburger was one of the best she had. I had the salmon pasta which I thought was great.
If you know me you know I LOVE FOOD! And this place is on the top of my list of local favorites!! Try it and be adventurous...and thank me later!!

ADVICE: the idea of Japanese & Italian mixed together does not sound too appeasing -- BUT DON'T JUDGE IT UNTIL YOU TRY THEIR AMAZING CREATIONS! I was pretty skeptic of trying this place but I'm glad I did. Every time I come here I find something new I like. I am not a fan of sea urchin or "uni," but i only had that with sushi. The uni pasta is simply amazing! My sister pushed me to try it as she described uni as the butter of the sea. I love the bruschetta & the deep fried octopus! Also try the GINGER ALE! So crisp and fresh!

I came here for lunch and I totally pigged out:

Ginger Ale: The spicy kind! Too bad the bottle is a little small.  

Daikon and Dried Tomato Salad: It had japanese radish, shiso, sun-dried tomatoes, and a citrusy sour dressing.  I like sour, but this dish was sensory overload.

Mussels Three Styles: The three styles wre tarako, tomato and a green veggie (artichoke?).  They were cooked like escargot, but instead of heavy butter and garlic, they were lighter and had a fresh taste.   

Black Sesame Blanc Mange: This was the highlight of my meal.  It was firm, creamy, not too sweet and just the right size.

Based on my two visits, I like the food and LOVE the desserts.
Food was delicious, a little on the pricey side. Uni tomato pasta was the stand out favorite. Squid ink pasta and miso carbonara was alright.

A unique fusion of Italian and Japanese cuisines. We loved the  bruscetta, mussels 3 way, and octopus tartar appetizers.  The staff was really great and we loved the open kitchen style. 

This is definitely a gem off the strip. Great prices too!

Brand new joint on spring mountain... Absolutely love it!! Tried sea urchin tomato cream pasta & miso carbonara and both were to die for. OK, I guess it's a bit pricey for pasta, but I can't think of anywhere else to eat this kind of food in this town, so I am not complaining... besides, portion is fairly large. Server is attentive, chefs are friendly. Will definitely repeat until i conquer every items on the menu - great alternatives when Ichiza or Monta is just too busy to seat you immediately. No signs outside yet... it's on the same mall as Monta & Raku. Give it a try!

Ate there yesterday. We ordered the Calamari lemon garlic sauce & Tomato farci gratin as appetizers. Our main dish was Kobe beef outside skirt steak & Spaghetti  in miso sauce with pancetta. Dessert was the Soy milk panna cotta with black sugar sauce. It was very good!  Need to try their Kome Kome Sake.This meal was perfect for two people & price was reasonable. The food was excellent. All fresh ingredients. The sauces were delicious. Will be back again with family & friends.
Japanese & Italian fusion. We ordered beef carpaccio along with 2 different kind of salads. It was delicious!

We came here on holiday at the recommendation of Yelp reviews and an interest in something original and all of us were incredibly disappointed; not only was the food relatively flavourless, but the restaurant itself was unpleasant and the prices were extortionate for what you got.
The first thing we noticed was the unpleasant smell coming from the kitchen, presumably the mix of Japanese and Italian herbs, but it made the entire night uncomfortable.
We then had the squid carpaccio, kara-age fish, Kobe beef, seafood linguini and some sort of cheesy fried pork. The squid and Kobe beef were both very tough while the beef was a meager 4oz, the linguini and pork were both edible but uninspiring and the fish was nothing more than an overpriced, tiny fish and chips.

I would not recommend this place if you like food or money, total waste of our time...

Amazing. This place is awesome. It's a mix off Japanese and Italian and it's everything great about both mixed. I haven't been disappointed on any of the entrees I've ordered. Appetizers were delicious too.

A friend recommended this Japanese pasta restaurant, and I'm glad I took him up on this.  The pasta dishes are very delicious.  Had the squid ink and the salmon roe pasta and WOW! they were great.  The staff is awesome.  The price, very reasonable. The portions were more than adequate. This is definitely a go to place when in Vegas.
Very cute little place, great food, excellent service, attention to every detail, reasonable  priced. Will be back

YUM!
I met my darling friend from HS for dinner here. She, my husband, and I shared:
Soft shell crab
Bruschetta
Uni cream pasta
some meat dish, can't remember what it was
Pasta with meat sauce
Black sesame blanc mager

We are definitely coming back.

It's going to be a challenge to try something new because everything we had was so good we'd probably order the same things again!

One con was the parking. The plaza is very small so we parked on a side street and walked over.

uni tomato cream sauce, kurobota pork salad
attentive service

?????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????

Felt like Italian and the regular haunts on the Strip weren't looking particularly appetizing or worth the hassle this Memorial Day weekend so looked up Italian and happened across this. I know I just came back from Japan on business but wanted to see if this Japanese Italian place would hold up to actual Japanese establishments.

Got there and it was about 1/3 full. Got a table immediately. Score. Would have been probably 2 hrs to get anything on the Strip if able to get in at all.

Service was good by the two Japanese waitresses. Very friendly and gave detailed explanations.

We started off with the bruschetta trio (octopus/avocado/wasabi mayo, tuna/mentaiko, daikon). I liked the daikon the best. Light and subtle. Others were ok. The mentaiko tasted more like tarako since it had no spiciness to it but still decent nevertheless.

I ordered the uni tomato cream pasta, others the ikasumi and shrimp and tarako cream pastas. They were all good. I think I liked the two cream pastas the best. However, like another reviewer I felt like there wasn't really an uni taste to it. More like a rich and creamy tomato cream. They also had Bafun Uni pasta which I should have gotten since I believe that was just uni and not tomato cream. I realized that after the fact... Oh well.

We were all full but we couldn't be stopped. We finished off with the dessert trio which included the pannacotta with kurozato sauce, black sesame blanc mange and Nakamura style tiramisu. We also ordered the warabimochi w/kinako and green tea gelato because warabimochi is one of my favorite desserts. All were very good. If I had to make a choice I would go with the three other than tiramisu. Not that the tiramisu wasn't good but there's only so much you can do with tiramisu and I've had so much there's no surprises anymore.

All in all a great choice. Would go back if struggling between Japanese and Italian or just to have good "Italian" food.
A great find in LV for a different Japanese take on pasta. Service is very good. Bread rolls are fresh. Happy hour is a must visit!
Service is very friendly, food is ok. I expected a little more based on the other reviews. Not bad, not great.

My wife and I had been intrigued by the idea of a fusion between Japanese and Italian food and decided to give this place a try.  Trattoria did not disappoint.  the decode inside is welcoming, friendly, simplistic and does not overdo it like a lot of the eateries in the complex and area with their tacky signs, cramped dining rooms and obscene wait times.

We opted to do one of the preset menus that would allow us to get a flavor for the restaurant's offering within a reasonable budget.  The calamari was not fried  (a nice change of pace) with seasoning and sauce.  The octopus was lightly fried and served with a lemon wedge and garnish.  I have to admit I was skeptical going in and having carbonara at a japanese restaurant.  That being said, I enjoyed this rendition of carbonara second most the carbonara I had in Italy.

The only regret we had from our visit was they were out of the green muscles.  This is always a great measure of an asian establishment.  We'll be back to try them.

I absolutely love this place. I have been here twice and always leave happy! 

It's definitely a little hidden gem stowed away in Chinatown. Small quiet cozy place and great for a date or even to bring the kids. 

It's a fusion of Japanese and Italian and everything is so delicately put together. For appetizers I have had the bruschetta and I just can't decide which is my favorite they all melt in your mouth. However I leave the place and crave the tuna bruschetta. The octopus with wasabi sauce is fantastic. I also had the beef carpaccio amazing!! We ordered the cheese platter and to my surprise it was great!! Usually I don't get that excited about cheese platters but definitely a must order.

For entrees I have been quite boring and both times ordered the Uni wild scallop tomato cream sauce pasta. I die and go to heaven every time I eat this. On one of my visits my Boyfriend ordered the squid ink pasta and I loved that too. But if your wearing white or have an engagement after dinner not the best choice your teeth will be black and if your like me it will be on your top no matter how hard you tried not to splatter. 

Great waitresses excellent wine list and by the glass. This place is on my top 5 places in Vegas!!

Raku was closed and monta was busy. 

We didnt have much time to look for restaurants so we just went into this place...

Their uni pasta is so amazing. It was the best meal I had during this trip. This place won me over - Over picasso and raku lol... Their dinner rolls were so delicious too. 

We also had hamburger steak, natton pasta and dessert sampler. They were really delicious. Service was excellent too. 

I strongly recommend this place.
Simply my new favorite restaurant. Baby octopus karage, bruschetta and all their pastas I've tried have been delicious. I love this place. So under rated !!

Unassuming little Italian-Japanese spot in a strip mall. The uni pasta though is out of this world, super delicious! Not sure about anything else since that's all I had but everything that came out smelled delicious.

I had been to many other restaurants in the complex and had always been curious about this place, but hadn't visited.  I am glad I did.  
While everyone is on the strip eating at places that are Iron Chef type places, I was happy to come here and enjoy an actual Iron Chef style meal.  What do I mean?  This place manages to pull off the Japanese and Italian combination quite well and it turns into something that is pretty unique.  If you're looking for standard fare, this isn't your place.  However, if you're looking to broaden your horizons and try something that'll push your taste buds in new directions, this place is it.  
Upon entering, the staff was very friendly and seated me at the bar.  I ordered the prix fixe and got their bruschetta to start.  Before it arrived, a warm roll that was quite good arrived.  When the bruschetta arrived, I was very happy to see that they were pulling off the Italian and Japanese combination as I had hoped for.  For the entree, I got the uni tomato cream pasta.  Technically, not on the prix fixe menu, but they upgraded it for a few dollars more.  The dish itself was a really interesting combination that managed to show off the uni and feel like a traditional Italian dish.  A real triumph if you ask me.  
I even got a dessert here in order to see how it was.  The tiramisu was for real.  A heavy cream on top and flavorful components below.  Not what you get at boring restaurants.  This is a culinary adventure and I was quite happy with the food.  I'll likely be back and will update my review accordingly.

First time trying here was great!!! Second time we wasn't able to be seated. The wife and I even rushed over to make it before they close at 11:30pm. We arrived at 11pm and was told they were closed!!!

Fusion from another Universe! Italian and Japanese?  It's a restaurant where the food, although very strange is actually good.  They should get 5 stars just for never of combining Italian and Japanese food - but when the food came out - it was really delicious. Who would have known?  You must try this just to see - food from the oddest of combinations!
Uni pasta hands down one of my favorite dishes!!  The only problem is they short pour wine.

Came by here last Friday evening a little after 9:30 pm with my husband after we had a disappointing experience next door at Sweet Raku (this restaurant is also located in the same plaza as Raku, Kilroy's and Monta Ramen). Immediately upon entering the restaurant, we were greeted by an employee. After being seated and browsing the menu, we ended up getting:

Halibut & Watercress Salad, $15 prior to tax- This item is not found in their menu but on their specials menu board. I decided to get this because I just wanted a salad for our late night dinner. The dressing came on the side, as I requested and had a nice sweet miso like flavor. The plating of this dish is beautiful, as most of the salad is served in a fried won ton bowl with large pieces of fresh halibut laid on top. Portion size is plenty for 2 people to share or make as a large entree for one. Watercress being quite a naturally peppery green, this dish does not need an additional amount of pepper, however, cracked black pepper topped the halibut (which was quite heavy on the black pepper). Although the halibut was great, it would have been much better with little to no black pepper. 

#38 Spaghetti Manila Clam & Shiso, $9.75 prior to tax- All I could taste in this dish was the basil. Although I do like basil, I thought it completely overpowered this dish. However, my husband really enjoyed this dish and said this is how his parents make their clams. For the price, you do get a fair amount of clams in this dish.

-----------------------------
(Total= $24.75, prior to tax)

Service was attentive and friendly. I was a little disappointed though when our server did not do anything for my birthday (as I had mentioned we were here to celebrate my birthday). However, our first server went home halfway during our meal (I assume she was getting off her shift). With our 2nd server, I don't think she knew we were there celebrating my birthday. Now some of you may think this is just trivial, but honestly, it just means that much more when a business will go that extra step just to celebrate with you (and things like that makes me want to tip higher). 

But aside from that, the food and service was good. I would come back here again in the future.

Excellent place! We loved both of the recommendations from the staff. Great deal as well with the prefixe menu. One app, one entree and a drink for 20 bucks. Can't beat it. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a tasty meal
Great place, a local favorite. Their menu is interesting and innovative. Highly recommended.

First time ever having Japanese Italian fusion and I must say this place impresses me! I ordered the uni tomato cream pasta and added chicken. That pasta is hands down the best tasting pasta that has entered my mouth. The uni and the tomato cream just meshes so well and created this very unique flavor. The appetizers were also very good. The beef carpaccio and calamari were absolutely delicious! I can't wait to go back!

The trend of 'Fusion Food' was bound to happen because since people have been immigrating into this fine country of ours, we have been fusing our native homelands food with what we have available or because we are just so damn creative. Seriously, you can stick almost anything in a tortilla and BAM, fusion food!

Trattoria Nakamura-Ya is the fusion of two great cuisines- Italian and Japanese. The menu is quite extensive with items that are Japanese and Italian but many items that are a combination of both. 

I met a fellow Yelp Elite here for dinner and as usual we shared our plates. We ordered prosecco and wine first because not only do us Yelpers like to eat, we also like a little drinky-drink. We decided on four items to share- two appetizers and two pasta dishes. 

The appetizers which I seriously recommend are the Octopus Capriccio and the Pork Shabu Shabu Salad. Both were solid especially the Octopus. I honestly think this one dish is great for both novice and veteran octopi eaters. It was fresh and anything with the word Capriccio, you know will be a hit. 

For the pastas, we ordered the Uni pasta and the Kinoko which is a creamy meat sauce. With the Kinoko you have a choice of pasta, we chose linguine which was a good choice because the pasta itself is thicker and can hold the sauce quite well. The dish is your traditional creamy meat sauce but with Waygu beef. Very nice! The Uni pasta was also a good choice because the Uni was not strong and did not overpower the sauce. There may have not been as much Uni as I would have liked but maybe my sharing partner hogged it all. It is a toss up!

Everything was great and the portions were good. Of all the fusion style restaurants or food trucks that I have been to, I have never had Italian and Japanese together. Trattoria Nakamura-Ya was an excellent introduction to combining both cuisines! So fabs!

* F O O D/P R E S E N T A T I O N: +1 star
* P O R T I O N/C O S T: +1 star
* S E R V I C E: +1 star
* R E V I S I T: +1 star

Oh my, the food here was super good. Idk if it was because we were like downright starving, but I think this is some of the best Japanese~Italian I've had in awhile! Simple, unique, and open until a pretty decent time, it was perfect for us! We were coming from RiSE and starving. The starting bread was great, appetizers were amazing, and the noodle dishes themselves were superb. Mmm, I can already imagine the amazing garlic with the squid. That tasty carbonara. Mmmm!

P A R K I N G

It looks full, but you can normally get a spot.

First off and foremost..I am a HUGE HUGE fan of Japanese-Italian cuisine. Japanese-Italian cuisine has actually been a long time cuisine done in Japan. Ever since I had the chance to have it there, I fell in love immediately! In my opinion Japanese-Italian food in Japan, I'd hate to say, blows a lot of highly rated italian venues, whether casual or fine restaurants I've had here in America out the water many times over. But again, that is MY opinion.

So I stumbled upon an article that was written about this place earlier this evening. I was convinced to try. It was already nearing 9 p.m. so I was also pleased that this venue closes at midnight.

When I arrived, there was a couple standing out front, wondering if they should come into try, when they saw me hastily walk in, they decided to follow. First off, I have to say, WOW! the place is C-L-E-A-N. Very Clean. Even better..The floor is clean!! I am big on clean floors in a restaurant . Call me slighty snobbish, but if notice dirty floors in a restaurant, I will instantly walk out. I cannot handle it. I wouldn't be able to enjoy my food because I would have already lost my appetite on the way in.

The set up of the interior and decor is simple, that stuff doesnt matter much to me anyway. As long as the place is clean and smells clean, the service is decent, and the food is overall great, that's whats most important.

The italian music they were playing was nice to listen to. The lady waitress came over and brought over a small woven basket. Just like they do it in japan, inside was your silverware, your straw, and your chopsticks, and served with a dinner roll on the side.

I ordered the Linguini Tarako and Scallop pasta and I also ordered the kobe beef carpaccio. You have the option of having a small plate or a big plate for the carpaccio..I went for the small in case I needed room to try another plate of antipasto.

One of my favorite dishes on the planet is carpaccio, and the two places that  Ive been impressed and perfected the carpaccio platter is  1. Mario Batali's Carnevino and Todd English's Olives carpaccio plate, which happens to be my overall favorite .

When I tried the carpaccio here, to say I was really really pleased with the taste! The kobe beef was really fresh, and it .was.good! I like how they used sea salt and not the regular salt, and it was not overly salty. unfortunately it may not be up to par with Carnevino or Olives, but it was nonetheless very very above decent, and I was impressed with it! Very goood carpaccio!!! and tasty!

I snacked on the dinner roll while I was looking at the menu to see what else to order but by the time I was deciding to order something else, my pasta arrived!

The pasta was served on a long plate so looks can be deceiving. Toppled on the pasta was the fresh Tarako, and saw my scallops. I could not wait to try....

OMG! The scallops were so fresh and were not overly cooked!! It was soft and tender, and just downright delicious! There was also just enough Tarako to mix in with your pasta, it turned out just right, not salty at all and just GOOOD. SO GOOD.. The sauce was light but it was filling. Seriously, skip the seasonings, you can forget about it. This pasta didn't need it, it was perfect. The basil, fresh tomato, and a hint of fresh onion and it was so subtle, i forgot that there was any. May I also add that I dont like onions, especially fresh onions in my food?

Overall, let me just end this by saying whoever this Chef is, knows EXACTLY what he is doing!! He is doing it good and doing everything right in this place. I am going back this weekend to bring my husband and let him be the judge. He's harder to impress than I am but I am certain he will love this place! 
I'm looking forward to trying the Uni tomato cream pasta..it just sounds too good, and I will definitely order the Kobe beef carpaccio, only this time I will order myself the bigger plate.

Worth my 30 minute drive on a late night weekday. Satisfied my hunger and pregnancy cravings. I'm all smiles and FULL!

I had this place on my list for quite a while and since I wanted to try something different I decided to finally stop here, although I was a little skeptical about their specialty, Japanese and Italian fusion? I wasn't sure what to expect, but maybe mixing two of my favorite cuisines could Actually be good. My friend was on the passengers seat so he had no choice but to follow and venture with me. The place is nice, nothing fancy, small but comfortable and practical, very Japanese. Service was good the waitress brought us our beer and food in a timely manner. As we get ready to eat, my friend rubs his chopsticks and tells me to do the same thing, that he read somewhere that it is good luck to do so. I didn't want to burst his bubble and tell him the real reason that you rub the chopsticks is to warm them up and in turn keep the food you're eating warm, so I rubbed the sticks for luck placed them down and started eating with my fork. the food was great we had the Italian spring roll and the  calamari in lemon garlic sauce for appetizers and we shared the manila clams with Torako pasta. I had to have something for dessert so I went for the Tarimisu. Everything was soo good, I think I'm a new fan of Jaitanese food. Next time I'm debating between eating Japanese or Italian I'll know where to go.....
....El Pollo Loco.....Just kidding.....about the chopsticks. 
  And as Arnold would say,  "I'll be back"

First time here service, food was excellent, reason for the return visit. Second time here food was excellent again, service was terrible. Waitress/hostess insisted on seating us squished/backed against a big party. This table has very bad lighting you can't see the menu or whatever you are eating very well. I explained that to her, and asked to sit at another table. She told me no that it was "reserved", throughout our entire time there, no one walked into the restaurant! At this moment we should have left, but against my better judgement we stayed.
My husband felt like we were discriminated against. If it weren't  for the two young women in black jackets who served us periodically  later this rating would be a 1 star. They were/are the stars of the restaurant. I guess the bottom line is I don't care how good your food is, service is 50% of your experience. We will not be back.

Great food experience! Me and my bf came to Las Vegas and we were planing to go to Monta Ramen (too packed) and stopped at this one! Everything came out more than expected, food was great at affordable price for quality dishes! We will definitely come again!! Love it

Small hole in the wall..
Good Friend turned me on to their linguine uni in tomato cream sauce,,,, da bomba

Exceptional fusion of Italian and Japanese cuisine. An absolute adventure for the 4 of us each with diverse palates. There is something for everyone. Great service, quiet personal ambiance, great food and drink. We will be back.

I have to say this was impressive. I read some reviews on this and thought Japanese Italian Fusion sounded good. I have had some Italian food while in Asia before and always found it to be amazing and quite different than what you find here Stateside. Needless to say I was impressed.

Ordered the Calamari to start. WOW.. Was huge delicious chunks of garlic bathed squid. Then 3 small baby squids all clamoring to be eaten at a high rate of speed. It was really good and the textures and flavors were a perfect combination.

Next.. I ordered the Kurobuta Pork Sausage w/ mushroom and Spaghetti. This was a real treat. It was has ruined all Italian places from this point forward. I am sold on this little place! It was an amazing mix of flavors and spices with noodles that were absolutely done perfectly. It was insane in fat as it was so light in textures but explosive on spices and flavors. Not spicy, but amazing flavors tucking into this sausages and sauce. Insane.. truly one of the best... no I think the best pasta dish I have ever eaten. Was truly a game changer for Italian food from this point forward.

My GF ordered up the Uni Tomato Cream Spaghetti. Holy smokes Batman! It was also the bomb and was a series of amazing textures and flavors. There is no real way to describe the spices as they are prevalent but not pushy, just perfect. The Uni was subtle but perfectly placed. The pasta was perfect!

I can't wait to go back!

This was pretty mediocre, I ordered the miso carbonara and felt that it needed a bit more flavor, it was sort of bland while the spaghetti was a bit rubbery. The service was decent. However, I liked their combos they offered in the back, for those who want a meal: an appetizer, pasta, and drink for around $18-$20 depending on which dishes you go with.

After living in Tokyo for a long time, I'm pretty familiar with Japanese-style Italian food.  This place is as good, if not better, than anything I ever eaten in the Motherland!  The friendly waitress recommended Uni Tomato Cream Spaghetti and it didn't disappoint.  So creamy and delicious!  The soft shell crab was one of the best I've ever had the pleasure of devouring, and the mixed greens with pork shabu-shabu and a lovely sesame oil vinaigrette was mind blowing.  Wash it down with an ice-cold  Kirin Ichiban Shibori on a 104 degree day and well...life is good!  !
Awesome food, got the spaghetti mentai carbonara, amazing. Service is excellent and the desserts are bomb.

Delicious fusion food! I regret not getting the uni dish everyone keeps mentioning in the reviews. What I did get was really good, it was ravioli in the creamy tomato sauce. The service was great and the chefs were so helpful in offering vegetarian variations to what I ordered.

After getting a recommendation from an acquaintance at our hotel, we came to this late night place which is absolutely fantastic.  Japanese and italian come together in wonderfully light, flavorful and innovative dishes that transport your palate from tasty to WOW!

Their jidori and crab salad is minimal yet packed with such flavor that it is refreshing and light.  I had the miso spaghetti with mushrooms it was the most amazing combination I have ever had.  Had there been more of us, I would have ordered many more plates just to try them all, like their squid ink spaghetti and many other mind blowing plates. 

This place is a definite must visit if you like to expand your flavor palate and go outside of the box with delicious, intense, mouth watering plates that will transport you out of Vegas into another flavor realm.

This place was rather disappointing. We wanted to have lunch before leaving Vegas for LA. We were tired of the Strip so decided to get lunch somewhere in Chinatown. This place looked interesting- Japanese and Italian fusion- so we wanted to try it out. Following Yelp recommendation, we got the grilled calamari in butter and garlic sauce. The two of us couldn't finish this dish - we probably are like 3 pieces. The sauce didn't have much flavor- it tasted like just butter and garlic. The calamari was very chewy and didn't taste fresh. For the main courses, we got the Uni pasta in creamy tomato sauce and beef hamburger. The uni pasta was good- the pasta was cooked just right, the sauce was creamy with chunks of Uni. It was a bit too creamy for my taste. Once again, we didn't finish this dish. The beef hamburger was pretty good. My boyfriend liked it a lot.

There are a lot of things that are good here. pricey but everything is tasty and fresh. A number of things have been tried but it is getting difficult to try more things because we always only want the uni pasta. we had tried a number of places in LA, nothing compares this far. This is the go to place for uni pasta

Amazing place must try!! Had the Spaghetti menntaiko Carbonera and for dessert had the green tea panna cotta with cream and red bean sauce!! Nice a cute place with great Authentic Japanese Italian dishes. With 5 people the service was great starting for Appetizer to dessert.

I finally had a chance to come back to States.  I have been away for a while overseas and it looks like it will stay that way. 

I was just in Japan 2 weeks ago and had some good stuff!  Funny thing is now I craved Japanese food in US.  While it can be authentic, the little touches make them quite unique that only surfaces here in the States.  So I've been hitting some ramen spots and all in this short trip I made. 

This place is legit! Very close to what you get in Japan. I've tried many wafu pasta in Japan and the states and so far this place is easily in the top of my list. I tried the special A course (18.99 for one appetizer, one pasta, and one drink) is a deal! I had a chicken salad and my wife had grilled veggies. Good flavor on both of them. The dressing was well flavored and the chicken was cooked on order. The veggies were grilled on order and the sauce was very tasty. 

I had Asari and mentai (cod roe) pasta and my wife had a kurobuta (pork) and mushroom pasta.  My pasta was pretty good. It was well flavored and I loved the little addition on perilla leaves and seaweed that really gave nice aroma and kick in your mouth. Her pasta was very tasty as well. The mushrooms had nice texture and the pork was delicious. The sauce had a nice smoky flavor and a hint of heat that made it fun to eat. 

We also had the tiramisu for dessert. It was very smooth and rich at the same time. This is what you expect from a pastry in Japan. Good stuff! =)

Only few things I noticed that I couldn't give this place 5 stars. First, the pasta was little soft. (it wasn't bad by any means but it wasn't al dente.  Perhaps it was but at the time we finished the pasta was pretty soft. It's hard when you get a sauce that is pretty thin though)

Second, my red wine was chilled.  I know Japanese people like to have the red wines chilled but I don't like it. (I know this is getting more popular as another form of drinking the reds, but it was a little tannic since it was chilled...not saying this is all bad. And I'll stop so I won't piss off the wine enthusiasts. =) )

And one last thing, please don't rush us by taking the plates away after 5 seconds of finishing it! We felt really rushed.  But the staffs were wonderful.

So, if you are in Vegas and wanting a good wafu pasta, now you know where to go!

Once while in Japan, I passed an Italian restaurant and jokingly asked why would I have Italian food in Japan? I was told the Japanese do it really well, albeit a bit of a Japanese-Italian fusion. Nakamura-Ya has got this nailed down. Those garlic bread rolls are amazing. The Hamburg steak is like Japanese comfort food. And their pastas are delicious. Definitely a regular visit here when we are in Vegas!

I finally got to try this place out with the boyfriend, after one of my student-workers had recommended it to me, and I was not disappointed with the service or the food. 
From start to finish, it was friendly customer service for everyone. I can see how loyal their patrons are. Hahaha... The entire staff got Hawaiian goodies from a couple that they seem to see on a regular basis for crying out loud! Anyway, we were constantly checked up on. LOL. I could see the smirk from our waitress when I tried hiding my squid inked teeth too, which I didn't mind at all. 
Food was definitely yummy, emphasized by the service. For appetizers, the boyfriend had a Garlic Bread, and I had the Bruschetta "Nakamura-Ya" Style. I did not know the Garlic Bread slice would come loaded, and I sure wish the boyfriend gave me a taste of it! All good though 'cause I had 3 different types of Bruschetta, and my fave was the one with Wasabi Sauce and Octopus. For main courses, the boyfriend had the Ravioli Spinach with Shrimp and Tomato Cream Sauce. It was as delicious as it looked, and the amount of likes on my Instagram of it is (kinda) proof. Hahaha... The Spaghetti "Ikasumi" Squid Ink looks as appetizing as it can be managed, but man... I liked it. I liked it a lot. 
Honest note: We were not a fan of the plaza area 'cause of the tight parking space X_x

Came here two days ago around 3:30pm right after work. Plaza was empty! Parking was a sinch and the restaurant only had maybe one or two tables so I was sat immeditately. 

It's their anniversary! I ordered the famous uni tomato pasta and it was delicious as well as a glass of pino and the octopus karaage. 

Everything was good although I though the baby octopus karaage portion was very small (3 pieces) and a little bit chewier then I really care for. I will probably just get regular calamari next time.

Dunk the bread in the uni sauce! 

Service was outstanding. I think I had three different people waiting on me.

I checked into Yelp right after I decided what to eat and ordered, I was home after eating 22 minutes later! Quickest dining experience I have ever had and they didnt even rush me (food was just that good!).

Will be back.

Had high expectation but this place was a disappointments, the price is high and a bit loud. over all the food i order the noodle was not even cooked all the way. What kind of Italian restaurant doesn't know how to cook noodles. The only reason i gave it 2 star is because the server was nice. But the food is worst then 1 star. Never going back and parking was a pain had to wait. I would not recommend this place

If you've been to Tokyo you'll appreciate that the Japanese take on Italian food is the opposite of American. Small intricate dished beautifully prepared and presented.  This is what you will find here.  
I think it's amazing and highly recommend you try it if you are looking for subtle and beautiful food.  It also gets you away from the strip and you can look around China town.

Alright, so this is one of those places that only disappoints me when I don't see a  star rating over all. Then again you can't please everyone! 

Honestly certain people just don't know what good food is or just wants something to complain about. But if you're a foodie and you live to eat, then you would want to order EVERYTHING on their menu!!!

Let's face it, this restaurant is Japanese based, so just that right there should tell you it's not gonna be cheap. It's not Chinese or Mexican, (which are generally on the cheap side) so don't call it a rip off, you're getting quality food. The portions are not as big as you like? Oh well I'm sorry isn't that why most of Americans are obese!? Once again, JAPANESE STYLE!!! 

Honestly though, I have never been disappointed here, if anything is that I could never try EVERYTHING on their menu....The Uni Tomato Cream Pasta is to die for! Their kara-age, ravioli, calamari, smoked mozzarella with tomatoes, and their desserts!  I wish I would have been in town longer just so that I can try more dishes on his menu!!

I will be back!

WOW!

One of my favorite places to eat in LV. 

I would recommend this place to anyone. 

Pasta is to die for. 

Great experience! 

Very interesting dishes. 

Only down part is parking. 

Parking is very hard to find.

Absolutely loved this place. Tried the Linguine Shrimp & Scallop with some type of spicy cod roll with it. It was very good. Also had the balsamic soft shell crab but I think they forgot the balsamic as it seemed the crab was in a buttery garlic sauce. Also had the fried oysters. They were good as well but the tartar sauce they serve with them was so bland it needed a bit of seasoning. Also ordered the Seafood Pescator which was excellent as well. Looking forward to going back & trying other dishes. Waitstaff was very helpful with menu as it had been our first time there. 4 stars since the tartar sauce & soft shell crab was a bit off.

Japanese-style pasta / Italian!

Yeah this category is what we were missing in San Francisco / Silicon Valley area. I'm glad we have a place like this here in Vegas!

I'm downgrading my opinion of this place after eating a second time.  The price is high considering the portion.  You can count the amount of meat on one hand on any given dish.  Some dishes have no meat on it.  The pasta portion is also very small.  I was still hungry after eating this place.  

The uni pasta is just a big hype and it wasn't even that good.  Just a normal creamy tomato tasting pasta that costs $30.  

One positive is it is okay to try once but I wouldn't come regularly unless you want a snack.

I've been waiting for the day this type of cuisine to come to Las Vegas.  Ever since the day my tongue tasted the wonderful uni spagetti at famous Cafe Hiro in Cerritos, CA, I've dreamt about my favorite fatty subtrates - UNI & carbalicious-al-dente pasta.

Trattoria Nakamura-Ya just opened a couple weeks ago.  So fresh and new that they didn't even have their liquor license when we went.  Hopefully, the license has been approved by now.  Like popular Raku in town, Trattoria Nakamura-ya has a chalkboard of their daily specials.  In this case, it was specials of their pastas and other dishes.  A sucker for advertisement, we went for mostly specials.

On to the food:
Fresh warm rolls - Fluffy, soft, warm.  Slather on a pat of butter...Need I say more?
Hirame Watercress Salad - This was fantastic.  The texture whore in me was jumping for joy.  The crunchy watercress paired with the crunchy deep fried cracker (?) and the tangy sweet dressing was perfect.  After breaking up everything and tossing well as recommended by our server, every bite was a texture sensation
Madai (Red Snapper) Carpaccio - Fresh snapper, crunchy sprouts and a touch of fish sauce.  Unique and delicious.
Uni & Tomato Cream Pasta - Al dente, al dente, perfectly al dente + buttery uni =)
Manila Clam & Torako Pasta - This dish was a touch salty but still enjoyable 
Scallops Sauteed in Marinara Sauce - Scallops are not my favorite seafood, but I could appreciate the tender meat and flavorful sauce.
Tiramisu & Creme Brulee- I love Japanese versions of non-Japanese desserts.  Somehow they make the level of sweetness perfectly to my liking (not too sweet).

Conclusion:  Fusion Japanese & I get along just fine.

This is my new favourite lunch spot in Chinatown. They have really good quality dishes for amazing prices! I love Italian food but it can be quite heavy at lunch and this is such a great balance of flavor and ingredients. Been here twice in a couple of weeks and will be back many more.

What an amazing experience.  This fusion is so unexpected and so amazing.  I had the beef carpaccio and the famous uni in tomato sauce.  Not only was the quality of the fish and meat amazing,  but the flavors in the sauce were so good on their own! When combined they were unstopable. My service was spectacular and I will be back because there were so many things on the menu I wanted to try.
Empty on a Friday night. Shocking because this place has quality dishes and sincere service. Great flavors.

I'm having an uni moment...

Yes I love uni and proud to admit it! Most of my friends want nothing to do with it and that just means more for me! 

This place is tiny and no wonder a lot of people complain about long wait times, what would you expect with only a few tables? 

Some how everything in the planet aligned the first time we went and we sat down immediately. It was the middle of the week just after 5pm, securing a spot before rush hour. 

We got a table at the window and the sun was shining right in to make our food look extra beautiful. I have to admit my hopes were high and knowing there was uni pasta on the menu I really wanted to experience it, especially since I never had it before. Luckily for me it was better than I could have ever hoped for. It was magical...

Bite after bite I closed my eyes and savored every single minute with this dish. I loved it. Pasta was cooked perfectly and that creamy and rich uni was all over it, melting to the warmth of the noodles. Holy shit folks, this was no joke. I could eat this every day! 

My girlfriend ordered spaghetti with meat sauce that was fantastic as well but back to my uni! Wow! I dream of this dish...

The service was really great, all the ladies were extra sweet and loved that we were both newbies and we also ordered Italian spring rolls that were great in flavor but didn't come with any sauce (we suggest they come with sauce). The warm bread was great and the ginger ale was delicious as well. Overall we loved our time here and will definitely be back. I can't imagine ordering anything other than the uni so this will be my ultra decadent dish of choice! 

So great! If you love uni this place does it right!
I got the miso carbonara and it was delicious. The service was also exceptional. I don't think I ever once got my water glass to less than half full.

We found this in yelp and satisfied! It's tasty n very Japanese style. Starved with bread n the noodle size is big for a female. Lunch happy hour price is very good. Staff is also very sweet n helpful. Recommend this restaurant! From their post, they will have anniversary special on 11/8-11/9. It's good if you can go on those days.

Super yum Japanese pasta place in Las Vegas! Appetizers are great and so are pasta dishes! I did not eat any mains this time but I bet it is good! 
One thing I always check when I go to the restaurant is the bathroom. People say cleanliness of the bathroom is a measurement of its kitchen.  This place's bathroom was sooooooo clean, I was even impressed how clean they keep it! 

Definitely a go-to place if you love Japanese style pasta! 

Thanks for getting my craving fixed!

I honestly thought everything was really good and perfect. I was hesitant reading some of the reviews but ended up making reservations for a family dinner for the boyfriend. There was a group of seven of us so we had a variety of food,and everything was so good. 

APPETIZERS - we had gotten the mussels: they come in 6 with 3 different flavors. It came in a cute dish and with little pieces of bread to pair it off. They were so good, literally melt in your mouth. The kobe beef carpaccio was also really spankin good! Nice big pieces and I paired it with the bread that was given for the mussels and it was really good. My personal favorite was the calamari! The sauce is garlicy and lemony and they top it off with almonds. It was so good we ordered another. I believe some type of ahi salad was ordered as well and it was very good. Everything good!!!

MAIN - We ordered the uni pasta, black squid ink pasta, miso carbonara, some type of risotto that takes 25 minutes to make, a pasta that had shrimp/crab with tomato sauce, and a chicken with japanese mushrooms and cream sauce. Everything was so frakkin good. The sauces weren't too heavy so it sat well in my stomach. Everyone at the table enjoyed each other's food haha The group of us don't really like heavy sauces, so this was very nice. 

DRINK - we all also had a amber lager asahi. It was good.

The waitress was really nice in explaining everything for us from daily specials to what's popular. Very friendly staff and clean bathrooms too!! I would definitely recommend this place. They have prix fixe menus where you can put one appetizer, one pasta, and one drink! They also have happy hour from 2-5 I believe :D

Everything is good and I mean everything. We came here with a party of 8 and tried a little bit of their recommended dishes and all were a hit. I loved my squid ink pasta and my hubby loved his uni and scallop pasta.

Disappointed for the last time.. 

I went again today since I was craving for some pasta.
Told the waitress that I have tried the Uni and the squid pasta so let her choose 3 pasta dishes and a main course just so I can try something different from this place. (If you're wondering about the Uni pasta its all the way on the bottom of my review.)

Quick summary to my most recent experience:

Wagyu with tomato cream pasta: watered down, cant taste the cream, tastes like canned crushed tomato with wet noodles.

Soy based pasta with mushroom and kurobuta pork: interesting since its like a pasta fused with ramen. Tasted like aglio e olio (olive oil and garlic pasta) mixed with shoyu ramen. So far this was the only good dish.

Japanese Carbonara: liquidy, flavorless, cant taste the egg, at least pasta is cooked perfect.. Took some of the left over home and added a fried egg which made waaay it better..

Kurobuta tonkatsu: pretty decent tonkatsu with cheese inside, under-seasoned..

Desserts: 
Panna cotta was delicious
Back sesame manger was so-so
Tiramisu was meh..

I've been to this trattoria a total of 4 times.
First time I was here I was about 4 years ago and was blown away by the Uni Cream Pasta and the Squid ink pasta. A month later I brought my friends here to show off my newly found "favorite place", ordered the same things only to be served watery versions of those dishes..
I went back a year ago since I was craving for some  Uni Pasta and let me just say that the perfectly cooked pasta and fresh Uni was the only good thing about the preparation since the sauce was, you guessed it, watered down and flavorless..

No joke.  Umi and tomato cream pasta will rock ur world. Here are other faves: squid ink pasta, miso carbonara, mussels served escargot-ish, chicken karaage.  Small dining room - so its best to head early.  We ventured in right at 2p to avoid the wait.  
This is Japanese Italia at its best and it's located right next to Sweets Raku - (save room and head there after).  Pasta bowls are in small servings - we ordered 3 main dishes along with apps for 4 adults - and it fed us all just fine.  Will definitely be back the next time we are in town!
Was in Vegas visiting my sister. She took me here. Pleasantly surprised. I liked it. Service was great.

From a Japanese person who has been to Italy many times I was blown away by their food! I went crazy and ordered multiple dishes. Most underrated dish there was the natto Gorgonzola pasta. It was SO good my kids even ate it. Perfect dashi soup and so elegantly mixed. I dream of having that again. Tomato uni was also awesome and so was the ikura salmon pasta light and creamy. I really can't say anything bad about this place. Clean store, clean bathrooms, and very friendly waitress. I would fly to Vegas to eat there again.

The warm rolls and the garlic cream sauce accompanying the pan-fried calamari were money.  The calamari itself was a bit chewy.  We also had uni pasta, squid ink pasta, yummy beef carpaccio, pork cutlet with mozzarella and tomato sauce, plum wine, Tobin James Sangiovese, and a domino cab.  I don't think the pastas were that great to be honest.  Very bland and one-note. 

They have pre fixe menus that are a good deal, and it comes with your choice of a house wine or pabst beer, an app and a main.  Your choice of entree is limited but you can upgrade to one of the more expensive dishes for $6.00.  Overall, everything was decent but a tad overpriced for what you get.  But I could bathe in their pan-fried calamari sauce...

Yummy bread and amazing pasta dishes!!  Servers were very helpful and gave great recommendations!  The prix fixe dinner menu had great choices and includes a glass of wine  :-)  Can't wait to go back and try another delicious meal.

This is my favorite spot within the Seoul Plaza.

I either get the Uni Tomato Cream, Squid Ink, or Risotto.

Everything I've gotten from the menu was delicious but these are my absolute favorites.

I always leave a big tip for the awesome food, drinks that are never empty, and great atmosphere.

Thank you to Chef Nakamura for offering amazing fusion cuisine!

This is totally my new favorite Japanese joint in Vegas - I live in Salt Lake City, UT, but grew up in Japan till I was 18, so I am very familiar with Japanese-Italian food, which I will say with respect to other Italian joints, will kick butt any day. :)  If you haven't ever had Japanese-Italian food, this is the place to go. Nakamura-Ya did not disappoint. The restaurant is very clean, and simply decorated - not pretentious at all - but you will find pasta cooked in perfect al dente,  light, fresh, quality ingredients, and carefully flavored sauces that will melt your mouth! They also serve the most delectable warm rolls with butter. I would move to Vegas for these rolls. 

The service was excellent - drinks, rolls, and our meals came out quickly. The servers fill your water quietly so you can carry out a good conversation without constant interruption. Their house white wine was so fruity and chilled perfectly. The prices are also very reasonable, and the portions are reasonable as well - I personally don't like restaurants that serve you portions enough to feed your family. They serve just enough for you to finish that evening if you're hungry, or a little to take home for lunch if you're a small eater. They also have a cool deal where you can order an beverage, appetizer and entree for $17. What a steal!! This restaurant embodies all that is amazing about Japan. Humble, but excellent!!

I went here for lunch with a group of friends because it sounded like a cool concept. Guess what? It's pretty freaking good! I had the carbonara lunch special that they have and was super satisfied. It was like a ramen version of carbonara. OMG. Yes, please. I can't wait to go back and try more!

We kinda relived our Japan experiences this past weekend in Vegas. Seeking out good restaurants serving, that much hated word, authentic Japanese eats, we were pretty successful. Trattoria Nakamura serves up the odd-sounding, but perfect-tasting Japanese-Italian dishes. The Japanese have been known to reinterpret other world cuisines in ways that make sense to them. Trattoria Nakamura is a perfect example of how they do this well.

I've not had too many experiences with Japanese takes on Italian pasta; however, I can tell you that this place prepares these dishes very well. He got the jidori chicken to start and had the wagyu beef pasta for his main. I, of course, ordered the famous sea urchin linguine in tomato cream sauce mmmmmmm.

Enthusiastic thumbs up from this foodie pair! He said the jidori chicken was really flavorful and juicy and unlike anything else he had ever had. The wagyu beef pasta came in a generous serving and really highlighted the American version of Kobe well. My sea urchin pasta was decadent and creamy, but not so rich that I got sick after a few bites. Nope, I pretty much emptied the plate. They were generous with the globs of uni, though they certainly should be with the $26 price tag. With that said, sea urchin pasta prepared this well is very hard to find. I've tried Italian takes on sea urchin pasta, usually ones that didn't include cream in the sauce, and found them too salty and the sea urchin flavor not discernible. Not here. The uni mixed with bites of the noodles and creamy sauce is pure bliss.

Besides the delicious and harder-to-find fare, we also appreciated the friendly service, also characteristic of Japanese establishments. In Japan, we noted how customer service was nice even when tip wasn't expected. In the U.S., tip is very much expected, but you'd never know that from this very kind, sweet server.

Get your carb fix here and see why Japan has more starred Italian restaurants than any other country in the world.
Uni pasta is so delicious, it's addictive. The service is good and the food proportion is just right.

4.5 stars, rounding up for uniqueness and fabulous service.

Heard about this place from a friend, who highly recommended the uni pasta dish. Came in with the BF and was a bit surprised by the prices on the menu and the variety of dishes- took us a long while to decide on our orders. Judging by the Top 10 List, it's a pretty common issue here.

Server was super sweet and polite and made several suggestions.
After browsing so many Yelp reviews that insisted on the uni tomato cream pasta, we finally caved and decided to split that as our entr√©e and add on a bunch of appetizers to share.

Total came to just under $50 before tip.
Shared the half order of FRIED OYSTERS (just okay), the ITALIAN SPRING ROLLS (didn't care for them at all- poorly executed and overpriced, take it off the menu), and the BRUSCHETTA- three different types served on three small circles of bread, a bit small to share but very tasty: one was seafood, another was avocado and wasabi, and the third was a mozzarella that was to die for. Wish it was served with two pieces of each type rather than just one though, just a hint of each flavor wasn't enough.

And then there was the UNI TOMATO CREAM PASTA, the dish sonnets are written for. I'm not  fan of uni at sushi restaurants but somehow this dish works really, really well- it almost comes off as a rosa sauce with clams, but roughly six billion times better. The uni is sneaky and it's flavor is in every bite but there isn't a large quantity of it in the dish itself. Somehow the extra shakers of red pepper and parmesan don't feel sacrilegious when you shake them on your serving.

Great hidden gem! Offering a Japanese-Italian fusion, Trattoria Nakamura-ya has a menu unlike any other restaurant in town (that I'm aware of). Their miso carbonara is my favorite dish. The sauce is light, not too rich or creamy like some carbonaras can be, and the miso flavor isn't overpowering. The serving size is perfect and prices are reasonable, especially for the quality.

It's a small restaurant, but service is great and they're well worth a try!
They have the "One of a kind menu." By that, I mean...Idk where else I can find a Japanese style Italian restaurant in Vegas.

Must try, Uni Pasta! 
Great food, and also servers were very nice!
Price: no need to discuss. Good good!
I felt like as if I were a VVIP.
It just that I had a hard time, finding a parking space. I recommend to park anywhere near the restaurant and walk because I think (don't remember exact number) there are 3 or 4 restaurants near there.
See you soon again.

Fusion for all the right reasons. The chef had an Italian style restaurant in Tokyo and has recreated this style at Trattoria Nakamura-ya. The specials are written on a chalk board and are very creative and delicious. My husband is fairly cautious about food that is too strange and he loved it. I can't wait to go back I am already craving their food.

I know Japanese Italian sounds strange but you just have to trust this one. I'm not a fan of uni but the uni tomato cream pasta was delicious. We also had the salmon carpaccio, octopus carpaccio, and the clams with linguine in a Japanese broth, all of which was fabulous. They do a great job keeping the flavors light and delicate. 

The service was really good and our waitress was great at making recommendations since we had a hard time wrapping our heads around the concept of Japanese Italian. Portions were large for a Japanese place but small for an Italian place ;) so I recommend going family-style here. 

My only complaint is that the place needed to turn up the air conditioning. Very casual place no need to dress up. It's small so I would suggest making reservations on weekends.

I always loved this type of Japanese inspired fusion Italian food. This restaurant does it nicely. We had 2 orders of bruschetta which comprises of tuna, octopus and cheese. It was excellent. The fried chicken jido was tasty but portion a little small.
The spaghetti "wafu" Mentaiko & Calamari pasta comes in a light tasty sauce. Their signature squid ink pasta did not disappoint. 
Service was prompt and friendly. Will definitely be back to try more dishes.

GET THE UNI PASTA!!!!

I've been here more than 6 times and every time it's absolutely empty, this place needs to either change their name or change their advertising because their food is DEFINITELY worth the money and is the place to be for a cute date night out or just order to go. 

This restaurant is one of the best Japanese fusion places I've ever been to.

I phoned in an order for pick up: miso carbonara pasta. The pics on Yelp made it look so darn good and I was craving noodles (but let's be real... when am I not craving noodles?) Anyways.

I walk in around 4 in the afternoon and to my surprise the place is empty. As soon as I walk in I am greeted with a bright smile from a girl who has my food ready to go. It was about $14 and some change. I walk out and I'm happy that the cashier was so friendly.

The miso carbonara was so. fricken. good. Not too salty, flavor was just right, and the noodles were thin spaghetti, perfect for miso. I literally ate my pasta in one sitting, which probably wasn't a good idea, but I couldn't help myself. 

Would definitely come back here to try out other items. The menu looks very promising!

Italian Japanese Fusion. Heavy on the seafoods, very fresh and clean. I have been to these types of Italian restaurants in Japan, but this is really the only one I have found in the US. Stop in for the experience or just for some nostalgia

Had the Prosciutto fettuccine and the Kinoco creamy meat sauce with spaghetti with the soft shell crab appetizer. The soft shell crab was excellent and the two main courses were good but in different ways. The fettuccine seemed much more straightforward italian but very good while the kinoco was definitely italian with a distinct japanese influence. Definitely going back to try something more adventurous and would definitely recommend if you're looking for something a little different.
Creamy spaghetti I highly recommend here! I love the flavor there! Staff are very polite too!

I don't like uni.  I don't like it at all.

But the Uni Tomato Cream Spaghetti?  To die for! 

I took a risk and ordered it for the first time 4 visits ago and have not ordered anything else since because I am in love with this pasta.  I'm sure their other dishes are great but this Uni spaghetti is so deliciously sweet and savory that I cannot bring myself to order anything else.  It's that good!

Fortunately, I've tasted my friend's food.  My husband really likes their Wagyu beef and kurobuta pork hamburg steak.  He says it's "solid" and he's quite a picky eater.  Others really like the miso carbonara, the squid ink pasta, the Kurobuta Sausage and Mushroom.

I say go for gold and get the Uni Tomato Cream Spaghetti.  Do it!

This place is in the "best rest row," of Vegas so the standards were high, before I even walked in. 
The service is fine. We walked in on a Friday night without a reservation so, naturally, we were seated at the counter. 
The waitress did not attend to us as she did the "reserved" patrons and maybe it was because we were way in the corner.
The cute thing about this pseudo Italian and Japanese restaurant is that they serve you delicious little rolls with butter. The calamari/squid in lemon garlic was pretty tender, but it wasn't something I want to get next time.
I ordered the Uni Tomato cream spaghetti and Leo ordered the Asari Spaghtti (spaghetti that is brothy with some cod roe.)
The uni spaghetti reminded me of the Vodka spaghetti at Brio. Throw in some uni and butter and that was it. It was savory, but it's pasta. You really need to do something extra special to make it different. And this just wasn't it. 
Not for $30 a plate.
Would we come back? Probably. To try the squid ink pasta.

Came here for dinner through recommendation by a friend and was not disappointed! Loved the combination of Italian and Japanese flavour in the menu. We had an octopus carpaccio to start, a miso carbonera and the uni pasta dish! All were extremely flavourful. Not heavy at all! It's a very small cozy restaurant. We came with our 9 month old daughter and the waitress was very accommodating. Will definitely come back if we are in Vegas again!!

Japanese Italian fusion done well. I think this type of fusion can go all wrong easily but Trattoria Nakamura-Ya figured it out without putting a hefty price tag on it. Yes, the uni tomato cream pasta is $27 but it's something you can definitely share with 1-2 other people. I think the best way to approach this restaurant is Italian style aka Family style. Order 1-2 appetizers, one pasta, one meat entree, and maybe finish with a dessert (or go next door to Sweets Raku or Snowflake shavery). Items I recommend: Nakamura Bruschetta, Uni Tomato Cream Pasta, Miso carbonara, and Kurobota Pork. Enjoy!

This is probably one of the bet restaurants I've ever been! It's food and service are unbelievable! The ambiance Is nice as well. This place is a true Jem. Pasta is cooked perfectly, the sauces are just salted right and everything was delicious.  Not much more I can say but give it a perfect 5 stars.

Interesting concept of Italian and Japanese. I ordered the Uni pasta has so many others have recommended this. I also ordered the jidori chicken mushroom salad and the dessert sampler. Honestly, the uni pasta was a bit of a disappointment compared to all of the hype. The sauce was indeed creamy, but I would have liked a bit more of a sauce and the uni. The jidori chicken didn't seem like it was fried at all -- just seemed like regular chicken. However, the rest of the salad was fantastic! I loved the mix of mushrooms, with the light dressing. Also, the desserts were delicious! Their sampler comes with their 3 most popular desserts: the black sesame pudding, pana cotta, and the tiramisu. I'm not a fan of black sesame in general, but this was actually really good! 

Overall, i'd say 3 stars for the uni pasta, 4 stars for the salad and 4 stars for the dessert. I'd love to come back to try some of their other pastas.

I would say almost better than going to an authentic Italian restaurant! They know their pastas and how much sauce is necessary. Tastes so fresh, my mouth is watering now. You can't beat the price for Deliciousness! Had the clam linguini, so tasteful. Skip the bruschetta and get the octopus balls.

The Skinny: delicious fusion Japanese interpretation of Italian cuisine makes this a unique experience (3.75) service is always solid (4) value: a little pricey for what it is, you do get a bit of a discount when you order their set menus or come in during happy hour 2-5pm that is valid even during weekends. (3.75 rounded up to a four).

We've come here a few times in the past to soak in the Japanese/Italian goodness which is Trattoria Nakamura-Ya. We came in initially when the first opened and while the food was good, it was pretty pricey. Fast forward a few years later, they have instituted a more reasonable set menu pricing as well as a good happy hour which encourages us to come back more frequently.

Let me review their happy hour.
